properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for this morning. Lake effect snow bands will slowly weaken today with additional accumulations of 2 to 4 cm possible by this afternoon. Motorists should be prepared for quickly changing and deteriorating driving conditions. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for this evening and into Thursday morning. Lake effect snow squalls have developed in the area and are expected to intensify this evening and overnight. The snow squalls will likely impact the evening commute and travel is expected to be hazardous at times due to reduced visibilities. Additionally, tonight local snowfall accumulations may reach 10 cm by Thursday morning with locally higher amounts in the heaviest snow squalls. Gusty northwest winds will also lead to local blowing snow with these snow squalls. The snow squalls will begin to weaken Thursday morning, with additional accumulations of 2 to 4 cm possible by Thursday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-05T16:03:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-05T00:04:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0719877477.2019
Area: Guelph - Erin - Southern Wellington County, Kitchener - Cambridge - Region of Waterloo
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Smog Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High concentrations of fine particulate matter are expected to persist through Thursday morning. ### Smog especially affects asthmatic children and people with respiratory ailments or heart disease. It is therefore recommended that these individuals avoid intense physical activity outdoors until the smog warning is lifted. In Quebec, wood heating is the main source of fine particles that contribute to smog during winter. This activity generates the largest number of these particulates, more than industrial activities and transportation. Additional information: To learn more about the Info-Smog program, go to Environment Canada’s website at www.canada.ca/info-smog-program. For air quality indexes in Quebec, visit the website of the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques at www.iqa.environnement.gouv.qc.ca/contenu/index_en.asp. For the air quality index in Montréal, visit the Réseau de surveillance de la qualité de l’air de la Ville de Montréal’s website at www.rsqa.qc.ca (french only). To learn more about the effects of smog on your health in Québec, visit the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux’s website at www.quebec.ca/en/health. You can also visit the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal at www.santemontreal.qc.ca/en/public. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-12-05T21:29:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques, the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux, the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal, the City of Montréal, 2019-12-05T06:23:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1016280936.2019
Area: Saint-Jérôme area, Lachute area, Saint-Eustache area, Longueuil - Varennes area, Laval area, Montréal Island area, Châteauguay - La Prairie area, Soulanges area, Vaudreuil area, Saint-Rémi area, Valleyfield - Beauharnois area, Hemmingford area, Huntingdon area, Berthierville - Saint-Gabriel area, Rawdon - Joliette area, Mascouche area, Ashuapmushuan Wildlife Reserve area, Normandin - Péribonka area, Alma - Desbiens area, Saint-Félicien - Roberval area, Falardeau - Mont-Valin area, Sainte-Rose-du-Nord area, Ville de Saguenay area, Rivière-Éternité - Petit-Saguenay area, Tadoussac - Baie-Sainte-Catherine area, Sorel - Yamaska area, Saint-Hyacinthe - Acton Vale area, Verchères - Beloeil area, Saint-Jean - Marieville area, Lacolle area

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls possible this evening into Thursday morning. Lake effect snow, at times heavy, is expected through this evening and overnight. Snowfall accumulations of 5 to 10 cm are expected by Thursday morning, with locally 15 cm possible in the heaviest snow squalls. Gusty northwest winds will also lead to local blowing snow with these snow squalls. The snow squalls will begin to weaken Thursday morning, with additional accumulations of 5 cm possible by Thursday afternoon. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-05T15:50:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-04T23:51:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3337846685.2019
Area: Uxbridge - Beaverton - Northern Durham Region, Newmarket - Georgina - Northern York Region
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow, at times heavy, expected today. Total snowfall: 10 to 15 cm. Locations: Gander and vicinity, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Bay of Exploits, and Bonavista North. Time frame: until late this afternoon. Remarks: Snow will continue and become heavy at times near noon and early this afternoon. The snow will taper to flurries late this afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-12-05T21:59:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-05T14:18:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4099359178.2019
Area: Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Bay of Exploits, Bonavista North, Gander and vicinity

properties.Title: Update: High Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued For The Roseau River From Gardenton To Dominion City
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a High Water Advisory for the Roseau River from Gardenton to Dominion City due to expected high flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions by the local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2019-12-05T12:30:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2019-12-04T12:32:24-06:00, 179D94AF-83C2-D77A-4EC4-C03C8B6F5932
Area: Roseau River from Gardenton to Dominion City
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long period of snowfall with total amounts of about 20 cm is expected. A low pressure centre over the Gulf of Alaska will bring heavy snow to the South Klondike Highway - Carcross to White Pass. The snow will begin this morning and ease to flurries this evening. The highest snowfall amounts are expected near White Pass where upwards of 20 cm of snow is forecast by Friday morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-06T05:42:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-05T13:43:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1751816388.2019
Area: South Klondike Highway - Carcross to White Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Lake effect snow squalls continuing this morning. The snow squalls will begin to weaken later this morning, with additional accumulations of 5 cm possible by this afternoon. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-06T00:02:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-05T09:46:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1595208663.2019
Area: Midland - Coldwater - Orr Lake, Orillia - Lagoon City - Washago, Barrie - Collingwood - Hillsdale, Innisfil - New Tecumseth - Angus
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Long-lasting blizzard conditions, with near zero visibility in snow and blowing snow, are expected to develop early this morning. Although the visibility may briefly improve at times, the hazardous conditions are forecast to continue into Friday. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-06T04:14:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-05T12:15:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0275865815.2019
Area: Tuktoyaktuk - East Channel Region
